1.text: Open a window and turn on a vent or fan to ventilate the room.

2.text: Put on a facemask, gloves, and protective eyewear.

3.text: Read all of the instructions for using your cleaning product.

5.text: Throw away absorbent or porous items that are moldy.

6.text: Use bleach to effectively kill mold on surfaces.

7.text: Opt for hydrogen peroxide as an effective bleach alternative.

8.text: if you want a natural treatment.

9.text: Use baking soda for a natural option that also removes odor.

10.text: Try borax for a natural mold treatment.

11.text: Use tea tree oil if enjoy cleaning with essential oils.

12.text: Make a 1:1 solution of clear ammonia and water for a strong cleaner.

13.text: Purchase a commercial bleach cleaner for an easy option.

14.text: Scrub the mold with soap and water to clean the surface.

15.text: Apply your cleaning solution to the mold to kill it.

16.text: Allow the cleaner to sit for 15 minutes to 1 hour so it penetrates the root.

17.text: Scrub the surface with a stiff-bristled brush, if necessary.
